name: RPA.Tasks
doc:
Tasks is a Robot Framework library for controlling task execution inside a suite. It allows changing the next scheduled task or jumping immediately to other tasks by using the keywords it provides.

If Graphviz is available, it will also create a directed graph to visualize connected tasks, which is visible in the suite documentation field of the test log.

param execution_limit:
 Maximum number of tasks to run in suite, used to prevent infinite loops
param schema:Path to optional schema file
param graph:Render execution result as graph using graphviz
param graph_inline:
 Inline graph into log, instead of saving as file

inits.name: Init
inits.doc: Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
inits.shortdoc: Initialize self.  See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

keywords.name: Jump To Task
keywords.doc: Jump directly to given task, skipping the rest of the task execution. If run inside a teardown, also skips the rest of the teardown sequence.
keywords.shortdoc: Jump directly to given task, skipping the rest of the task execution. If run inside a teardown, also skips the rest of the teardown sequence.

keywords.name: Jump To Task If
keywords.doc: Jump directly to given task according to the condition.
keywords.shortdoc: Jump directly to given task according to the condition.

keywords.name: Jump To Task If Keyword Fails
keywords.doc: Executes given keyword and jumps to given task if it fails.
keywords.shortdoc: Executes given keyword and jumps to given task if it fails.

keywords.name: Jump To Task If Keyword Succeeds
keywords.doc: Executes given keyword and jumps to given task if it succeeds.
keywords.shortdoc: Executes given keyword and jumps to given task if it succeeds.

keywords.name: Set Next Task
keywords.doc:
Set the next task to be executed. Should be a task in the same suite.

param name:Name of next task
keywords.shortdoc: Set the next task to be executed. Should be a task in the same suite.

keywords.name: Set Next Task If
keywords.doc:
Set the next task according to the condition. If no default is given, does not modify execution order.

param condition:
 Condition expression to evaluate
param name:Name of next task, if successful
param default:Name of next task, if unsuccessful
keywords.shortdoc: Set the next task according to the condition. If no default is given, does not modify execution order.

keywords.name: Set Next Task If Keyword Fails
keywords.doc: Executes given keyword and sets the next task if it fails.
keywords.shortdoc: Executes given keyword and sets the next task if it fails.

keywords.name: Set Next Task If Keyword Succeeds
keywords.doc: Executes given keyword and sets the next task if it succeeds.
keywords.shortdoc: Executes given keyword and sets the next task if it succeeds.
